Still Mine
Drama, International, Gentle, Touching
["James Cromwell gives a tour de force performance in 'Still Mine,' a deeply moving love story about a couple in their twilight years. When Craig sets out to build a more suitable house for his ailing wife Irene, he is blindsided by the bureaucratic codes and officials. As Irene becomes increasingly ill, Craig takes a final stance against all odds to finish the house, in a truly inspirational story."]

profile:
**User Summary:**

The user continues to cultivate a strong preference for heartfelt narratives and emotional depth in storytelling while their viewing choices evolve to reflect a more nuanced taste. Despite a previous high average rating of 3.9, their recent interaction reveals a more critical stance toward films that fail to stand out. The user rated a recent drama with a solid cast and an inspirational theme lower than expected, indicating a growing expectation for originality and meaningful content even in mainstream cinema.

The shift towards lighter plots appears to continue, yet the user maintains a requirement for quality and narrative coherence. Their latest review, which described a film as "all right, but nothing special," highlights an increased discernment and a desire for stories that not only entertain but also resonate on a deeper level. 

The user appreciates performances that bring emotional clarity and is refining their selection criteria to prioritize impactful storytelling—translating a flexible approach to preferences that incorporates both depth and enjoyable narratives. The overall trend is a discerning viewer who is progressing towards enriching media offerings while continuing to search for films that evoke lasting emotional connections amid a backdrop of evolving tastes.
